bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Domingo F. Ramos, November 22, 1941

div1.p: Hench sends Ramos two reprints of his article on yellow fever which touches upon the work of Finlay.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Domingo F. Ramos, November 22, 1941
div1.opener:
November 22, 1941
His Excellency, Dr. Domingo F. Ramos
Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Ramos:
div1.p:
Permit me to send you by separate post two reprints of a
recent article of mine on the conquest of yellow fever. Although in
this short article I was only able to touch upon the work of Dr. Finlay
I hope indeed that you and my other Cuban friends will see in it (and
in the painting which it describes) at least the first step in an
attempt to bring to the attention of American physicians the greatness
of Dr. Finlay and his tremendous contribution to the conquest of yellow
fever. We Americans don't know him well enough and in turn we would
like Cubans to know Dr. Reed and his colleagues better. They are all
inseparable in glory! It delights me that I can work in a small way
toward a better understanding between the Cuban and American medical
professions. Especially in times like these the bonds of friendship
and comradeship are so terribly important.

Should you wish more copies of my reprint or a larger copy
of the painting I will be delighted to see that you receive them.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
